Articles.Content:
So, I've been experimenting and such, and so, I'm going to post the pictures I make. I will be updating this as it goes.

Here's one showing my first inter-planetary voyage. I made this in thirty minutes in paint, don't expect much. It's my first image made in paint too, and my first attempt at Internet Art. Made in paint.

Here is another one of my first spacestation. Made in just some thirty-three or thirty-five minutes. my second image/attempt. Pretty simple. Made in paint.

And even more.

My response to Henri Von Braun

NOTE : These are all made in Microsoft Paint. Do not expect much.

Edited June 11, 2013 by NASAFanboy
I like how simple it is. And the CM is the best part.
I'm trying programs other than paint. Any good suggestions?

I'm trying programs other than paint. Any good suggestions?

Paint.net,wonderful program.
Nice pictures! Why not one of Jool and its moons?

Nice pictures! Why not one of Jool and its moons?

Challenge Accepted. I will be back later.

I'd recommend Paint.NET. It's free, and it's practically MS Paint but with more versatility. If you can use MS Paint, you can use Paint.NET. Paint.NET also has layers, transparency, easy full spectrum colour selection, and a lot of image editing tools that you can learn to use when you improve.

I'd recommend Paint.NET. It's free, and it's practically MS Paint but with more versatility. If you can use MS Paint, you can use Paint.NET. Paint.NET also has layers, transparency, easy full spectrum colour selection, and a lot of image editing tools that you can learn to use when you improve.

I'm messing with some of it's features, right now.
This reminds me of a NASA Picture book that adored when I was three.
